trans-unit.source: IP interface name
IP interface name.

IP mask, in dotted decimal notation, for the IP Pattern parameter. Can have leading or trailing non-zero octets (for example, 255.255.240.0 or 0.0.255.255). Accordingly, the mask specifies whether the first n bits or the last n bits of the destination IP address in a client request are to be matched with the corresponding bits in the IP pattern. The former is called a forward mask. The latter is called a reverse mask.
IP multicast address used by the cache routers. For the FortiGate to ignore multicast WCCP traffic, use the default 0.0.0.0.
IP network wildcard bits in decimal format between 0 and 32.

IPv4 address or subnet on the external network to substitute for the resolved address in DNS query replies. Can be single IP address or subnet on the external network, but number of addresses must equal number of mapped IP addresses in src.
IPv4 address or subnet on the internal network to compare with the resolved address in DNS query replies. If the resolved address matches, the resolved address is substituted with dst.

IPv4 or IPv6 address of the server. If you create an IP address based server, you can specify the name of the server, instead of its IP address, when creating a service. Note: If you do not create a server entry, the server IP address that you enter when you create a service becomes the name of the server.
IPv4 or IPv6 address or FQDN to send trap messages to.
IPv4 or IPv6 address or FQDN. A port number may be appended.
IPv4 or IPv6 address to assign to the virtual server.
IPv4 or IPv6 address. If both addresses are required use ipv4-address and ipv6-address fields explicitly.

IPv4 or IPv6 address. If both addresses are required use ipv4-address and ipv6-address fields explicitly. This parameter is not required in case "method" parameter is "hide" and "hide-behind" parameter is "gateway".
IPv4 or IPv6 network address. If both addresses are required use subnet4 and subnet6 fields explicitly.
IPv4 or IPv6 network mask length.

IPv4 or IPv6 network mask length. If both masks are required use mask-length4 and mask-length6 fields explicitly. Instead of IPv4 mask length it is possible to specify IPv4 mask itself in subnet-mask field.

IPv4 or IPv6 network mask. If both masks are required use ipv4-network-mask and ipv6-network-mask fields explicitly. Instead of providing mask itself it is possible to specify IPv4 or IPv6 mask length in mask-length field. If both masks length are required use ipv4-mask-length and ipv6-mask-length fields explicitly.
IPv4 or IPv6 peer connection address.

IPv4 or named IP address. Must be of the same scope (regional, global). Reserved addresses can (and probably should) be used for global forwarding rules. You may reserve IPs from the console or via the gce_eip module.

Ideal for Day 0 initial configuration.
Idempotence works only if you’re specifying a drive letter or other unique attributes such as a combination of disk number and partition number.
Idempotency reference given when creating cloudfront distribution
Idempotent actions that will create/modify, destroy, or reset a cache parameter group as needed.
Identification string of network.
Identifier for Azure Insights metrics of namespace.
Identifier for the routing protocol for configuring redistribute information.
Identifier for the virtual sub-interface.
Identifier for this instance or set of instances, so that the module will be idempotent with respect to EC2 instances.
Identifier of the column family.
Identifier of the current Stack action.

Identifier of the module as listed by apache2ctl -M. This is optional and usually determined automatically by the common convention of appending _module to name as well as custom exception for popular modules.
Identifier. Can be used for documentation, in or tasks/handlers.
Identifiers of the Read Replicas associated with this DB instance.
Identifies a network flow by the local IP address.
Identifies a network flow by the remote IP address.
Identifies a service specified by the local port.
Identifies the column in the record.
Identifies the incident to which this state should be applied.
Identifies the key in the record column, when the column is a map type.

Identifies the managed zone addressed by this request. This must be a dictionary that contains both a 'name' key and a 'dnsName' key. You can pass in the results of the gcp_dns_managed_zone module, which will contain both.
Identifies the position of the member in the array that is an arbiter.
Identifies the predefined or custom IPS signatures to add to the sensor.
Identifies the record in the table.
Identifies the resource associated with the metric type
Identifies the set of interfaces that should be configured in the VRF. Interfaces must be routed interfaces in order to be placed into a VRF.

Identifies the set of interfaces that should be configured in the VRF. Interfaces must be routed interfaces in order to be placed into a VRF. The name of interface should be in expanded format and not abbreviated.
Identifies the table in the database.
Identifies what kind of resource this is.
Identifies which user authentication method to use.
Identify the node in the syslog message. (HOSTNAME/IP_HOSTNAME/LAN/MGMT)
Identify with github token rather than username and password.
Identifying what the user is asking to be authorized for, enables the TACACS+ server to behave differently for different types of authorization requests.
Identity
Identity document version.
Identity for the VM.
Identity modules
Idle time, in minutes, after which a persistence entry is cleared.
Idle time, in seconds, after which a client connection is terminated.
Idle time, in seconds, after which a client connection is terminated. Applicable if connection proxy based site persistence is used.
Idle time, in seconds, after which the client connection is terminated. The default values are:
Idle timeout in minutes.
Idle timer in minutes (0 for disabled).
If "+" is specified in begin of value, the value will be added.
If "+" or "-" is not specified, the total value will be the specified.
If "-" is specified in begin of value, the value will be removed.
If "absent", SSL termination will be removed instead.
If "false", attempting to destroy a fenced LUN will fail.
If "false", destroying an online and mapped LUN will fail.
If "true", override checks that prevent a LUN from being destroyed if it is online and mapped.
If "true", override checks that prevent a LUN from being destroyed while it is fenced.
If "true", the load balancer will *only* accept secure traffic.
If "true", the load balancer will redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS.
If "yes", ensure the check is created, but don't actually use it yet.

If “archive” is true the system will attempt to create a compressed tarball of the running container. The “archive” option supports LVM backed containers and will create a snapshot of the running container when creating the archive.
If ‘false’, invalid attributes for a task will result in warnings instead of errors
If ‘true’ it is a fatal error if every single potential inventory source fails to parse, otherwise this situation will only attract a warning.
If ‘true’, it is a fatal error when any given inventory source cannot be successfully parsed by any available inventory plugin; otherwise, this situation only attracts a warning.
If 'all' is passed one must omit host and hostgroup.
If 'enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'disabled', the rule is not currently being applied.
If 'false' or not specified, the request will fail if there are any igroups bound to this portset.

If 'state' is 'present' and the stack does not exist yet, either 'template', 'template_body' or 'template_url' must be specified (but only one of them). If 'state' is 'present', the stack does exist, and neither 'template', 'template_body' nor 'template_url' are specified, the previous template will be reused.

If 'state' is 'present' and the stack does not exist yet, either 'template', 'template_body' or 'template_url' must be specified (but only one of them). If 'state' is present, the stack does exist, and neither 'template', 'template_body' nor 'template_url' are specified, the previous template will be reused.
If 'true', NFS server will honor SetUID bits in SETATTR operation. Default value on creation is 'true'
If 'true', forcibly destroy the portset, even if there are existing igroup bindings.
If (true) ephemeral virtual machine will be created. When destroyed it won't be accessible again.
If --diff option in enabled while running, the before and after configuration change are returned as part of before and after key.
If /usr/sbin/policy-rc.d already exist, it is backed up and restored after the package installation.
If 0 each record is returned as a dictionary, otherwise a string
If 7zip is installed on the system, this module extracts files from an ISO into a temporary directory and copies files to a given destination, if needed.
If :// in the path, ansible will attempt to download deb before installing. (Version added 2.1)
If Passlib is installed, vars_prompt can also encrypt the entered value so you can use it, for instance, with the user module to define a password:

If >0 and state is absent the module will retry up to absent_retries times to delete the stack until all the resources have been effectively deleted. If the last try still reports the stack as not completely removed the module will fail.
If 01-openstack.yml defines myvar = 1 for the group all, 02-dynamic-inventory.py defines myvar = 2, and 03-static-inventory defines myvar = 3, the playbook will be run with myvar = 3.
If ALL, this module will import all components configurations from SCP file.
If BIOS, this module will import BIOS configuration from SCP file.
If False, the module will fail under these conditions.
If Forced, it forcefully shuts down the server.
If Graceful, it gracefully shuts down the server.
If Http or Https is specified, a 200 OK response from the specified URL is required for the probe to be successful.
If IDRAC, this module will import iDRAC configuration from SCP file.
If NIC, this module will import NIC configuration from SCP file.
If NoReboot, it does not reboot the server.
If Off, End host power state is off.
If On, End host power state is on.
If RAID, this module will import RAID configuration from SCP file.
If Tcp is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful.
If True then this rule set will be made active and all others inactive.
If VULTR_API_ACCOUNT environment variable or api_account module parameter is not specified, modules will look for the section named “default”.
If absent a module is removed.
If absent a repository is removed.
If absent the host will be deleted from the cluster.
If absent will ensure the app pool is removed.
If absent will ensure the mapped drive does not exist.
If absent will ensure the policy is removed.
If absent, all given values will be removed if present.

If absent, directories will be recursively deleted, and files or symlinks will be unlinked. In the case of a directory, if diff is declared, you will see the files and folders deleted listed under path_contents. Note that absent will not cause file to fail if the path does not exist as the state did not change.
If absent, it removes a network static route.
If absent, the file will be removed.
If absent, the host configuration will be reset to default values.
If absent, will ensure that the certificate specified by thumbprint or the thumbprint of the cert at path is removed from the store specified.
If absent, will remove a DNS server.
If absent, will remove an NTP server.
If absent, will remove organization.
If absent, will unset timezone.
If absent, will verify IP pool is absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify LAN Connectivity Policies are absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify MAC pool is absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify SAN Connectivity Policies are absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify Service Profile Templates are absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify UUID pool is absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify VLANs are absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify VSANs are absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify WWNNs/WWPNs are absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify that the Managed Objects are absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify that the disk group policy is absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify that the storage profile is absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify the resource is absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify vHBA templates are absent and will delete if needed.
If absent, will verify vNIC templates are absent and will delete if needed.
If add, each alias in aliases will be added to the host entry.
If add, the user is added to each group in groups where not already a member.
If always, the connection will only send email if the connection is Encrypted. If the server doesn't accept the encrypted connection it will fail.
If ansible-playbook fails, please follow the debug steps in Network Debug and Troubleshooting Guide.
If ansible_facts['distribution_version'] is greater than or equal to 12.04, this test returns True, otherwise False.
If ansible_network_os is not specified for a host, then Ansible will attempt to automatically detect what network_os plugin to use.
If api_token is not set within the module, the following environment variables can be used in decreasing order of precedence ONLINE_TOKEN, ONLINE_API_KEY, ONLINE_OAUTH_TOKEN, ONLINE_API_TOKEN
If api_token is not set within the module, the following environment variables can be used in decreasing order of precedence SCW_TOKEN, SCW_API_KEY, SCW_OAUTH_TOKEN or SCW_API_TOKEN.
If auto is selected, the service will start at bootup.
If backrefs is set, may contain backreferences that will get expanded with the regexp capture groups if the regexp matches.
If base64, data is a base64 string that is base64 decoded to bytes.
If base64, secret is a base64 string that is base64 decoded to bytes.
If become is unavailable, use win_hotfix to install hotfixes instead of win_chocolatey as win_hotfix avoids using wusa.exe which cannot be run without become.
If ca_file parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used.

If change, the md5 checksum will be downloaded and verified if the destination already exist, to verify if they are identical. This was the behaviour before 2.6. Since it downloads the md5 before (maybe) downloading the artifact, and since some repository software, when acting as a proxy/cache, return a 404 error if the artifact has not been cached yet, it may fail unexpectedly. If you still need it, you should consider using always instead - if you deal with a checksum, it is better to use it to verify integrity after download.
If cleanup, clean up the async job cache (by default in ~/.ansible_async/) for the specified job jid.
If client_cert contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.
If clone is specified, org_name is the name of the new organization.
If cluster_name is not given, this parameter is required.
If cluster_name is not set, then this parameter is required.
If cluster_name is provided, then vmhba facts about all hosts from given cluster will be returned.
If cluster_name is provided, then vmhba information about all hosts from given cluster will be returned.
If cluster_name is provided, then vmnic facts about all hosts from given cluster will be returned.
If cluster_name is provided, then vmnic information about all hosts from given cluster will be returned.
If context is not provided, it will default to all.
If cow format is used, disk will by created as sparse, so space will be allocated for the volume as needed, also known as thin provision.
If curated is selected the structure will be identical to input parameters of azure_rm_virtualmachinescaleset module.
If current, the current state of the VM will be fetched. You can access it with results.status
If datastore or cluster_name are not set, this parameter is required.
If datastore or datastore_cluster are not set, this parameter is required.
If datastore_cluster or cluster_name are not set, this parameter is required.
If dest ends with '/', it will use the basename of the source file, similar to the copy module.
If dest ends with \ then source or the contents of source will be copied to the directory without renaming.
If dest file doesn’t exist, it is created.
If dest is a directory, either the server provided filename or, if none provided, the base name of the URL on the remote server will be used. If a directory, force has no effect.
If dest is a directory, the file will always be downloaded (regardless of the force option), but replaced only if the contents changed..
If dest is a non-existent path and if either dest ends with "/" or src is a directory, dest is created.
If dest is a nonexistent path, it will only be created if dest ends with "/" or "\", or src is a directory.
If destination is set in CIDR notation format and mask is provided the mask parameter takes precedence.
If directory, all immediate subdirectories will be created if they do not exist.
If directory, all intermediate subdirectories will be created if they do not exist. Since Ansible 1.7 they will be created with the supplied permissions.
If directory, the directory will be created.
If disabled will ensure the policy is configured, exists, but disabled.

If docker_network or docker_volume were called with diff: yes, check_mode: yes or debug: yes, a return value called diff was returned of type list. To enable proper diff output, this was changed to type dict; the original list is returned as diff.differences.
If download, the md5 checksum will be downloaded and verified only after artifact download. This is the default.
If enable_ha is set to no, then this value is ignored.
If enabled the host is fully operational.
If enabled will ensure the policy is configured, exists and enabled.
If esxi_hostname is not given, this parameter is required.
If esxi_hostname is provided, then vmhba facts about given host system will be returned.
If esxi_hostname is provided, then vmhba information about given host system will be returned.
If esxi_hostname is provided, then vmnic facts about given host system will be returned.
If esxi_hostname is provided, then vmnic information about given host system will be returned.
If esxi_hostname is specified, then will assign the license key to the ESXi host.
If exact, the set of values will be forced to exactly those provided and no others.
If export, will perform SCP export operations.
If exported, will ensure the file at path is a certificate specified by thumbprint.
If false (NO CYCLE) is specified, any calls to nextval after the sequence has reached its maximum value will return an error. False (NO CYCLE) is the default.
If false then query depends on name presence and value.
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated.
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only set to false used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
If file, more information of the (existing) file will be returned.
If file, the file will NOT be created if it does not exist, see the copy or template module if you want that behavior. If absent, directories will be recursively deleted, and files will be removed.

If file, without any other options this works mostly as a 'stat' and will return the current state of path. Even with other options (i.e mode), the file will be modified but will NOT be created if it does not exist; see the touch value or the copy or template module if you want that behavior.
If flags is set, this will be ignored.
If folder is not set, then this parameter is required.
If gateway is not provided it will be set to 0.0.0.0.
If hard, the hard link will be created or changed.
If import, will perform SCP import operations.
If insertbefore is set, default value EOF will be ignored.
If instance_name is not specified, this field is required.
If key is unset, the module returns a list of dictionaries, where each dictionary is a row in the CSV file.
If latest a module is updated to the newest version. This option was added in version 2.8.
If link, the symbolic link will be created or changed.
If loaded, the backup file in src will be loaded to the ESXi host rewriting the hosts settings.
If local, the credential will persist for all logons of the same user on the same host.

If local_path is not set, the created screenshot file will be kept in the directory of the virtual machine on ESXi host. If local_path is set to a valid path on local machine, then the screenshot file will be downloaded from ESXi host to the local directory.

If managed is yes, it is very important that you do not have more than one device with the same name. BIG-IQ internally recognizes devices by their ID, and therefore, this module's cannot guarantee that the correct device will be registered. The device returned is the device that will be used.
If master=true, an optional stratum can be supplied (1-15). The device default is 8.
If mode=access, or mode=dot1qtunnel, used as the access VLAN ID, in the range from 1 to 4094.
If mode=hybrid, used as the VLAN range to ADD or REMOVE from the trunk, such as 2-10 or 2,5,10-15, etc.
If mode=trunk, or mode=hybrid, used as the trunk native VLAN ID, in the range from 1 to 4094.
If mode=trunk, used as the VLAN range to ADD or REMOVE from the trunk, such as 2-10 or 2,5,10-15, etc.
If mounted, the device will be actively mounted and appropriately configured in fstab. If the mount point is not present, the mount point will be created.
If name is not provided remote_host is used by default.
If name is set and exists, will return information on the task itself.

If netconf_port value is not mentioned in task by default it will be enabled on port 830 only. Although netconf_port value can be from 1 through 65535, avoid configuring access on a port that is normally assigned for another service. This practice avoids potential resource conflicts.
If never, the connection will not attempt to setup a secure SSL/TLS session, before sending
If never, the md5 checksum will never be downloaded and verified.
If no and the key is a url starting with https, SSL certificates will not be validated.
If no then it will only clear out the '(Default)' property for that key.
If no, SSL certificates are not validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
If no, SSL certificates for the target repo will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
If no, SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated,
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated.
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated. Disabling certificate validation is not recommended.
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be set to no when no other option exists.
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be set to no when no other option exists. Prior to 1.9.3 the code defaulted to no.
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. If the transport argument is not eapi, this value is ignored.
If no, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. If the transport argument is not nxapi, this value is ignored.
If no, an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection,
If no, an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
If no, apply action will not be performed. Relevant for ADC devices only.
If no, do not call svn switch before update.
If no, do not check out the repository if it does not exist locally.
If no, do not clone the repository even if it does not exist locally
If no, do not clone the repository if it does not exist locally.
If no, do not retrieve new revisions from the origin repository
If no, do not retrieve new revisions from the origin repository.
If no, extended update support will be requested.
If no, it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
If no, it will not use the proxy defined in IE for the current user.
If no, it will search for src at originating/master machine.
If no, it will search for src at originating/master machine, if yes it will go to the remote/target machine for the src.
If no, it will search for src at originating/master machine.
If no, it will use HTTP. Otherwise it will use HTTPS.
If no, save action will not be performed. Relevant for ADC devices only.
If no, stopping or restarting a service with dependent services may fail.
If no, sync action will not be performed. Relevant for ADC devices only.
If no, the environment variables http_proxy and https_proxy will be ignored.
If no, the file will only be extracted and copied if the destination does not already exist.
If no, the file will only be transferred if it does not exist in the the destination.
If no, the file will only be transferred if the destination does not exist.
If no, the module will search for src on originating/master machine.
If no, the notification will not pop up and will only appear in the Action Center.
If no, the patterns are file globs (shell).
If no, the tunnel will use fixed MTU or calculate its MTU using tunnel encapsulation configurations.
If no, then this module and other process will only be able to export the certificate and the private key cannot be exported.
If no, user will only be added to the groups specified in groups, removing them from all other groups.
If no, will not use the proxy as defined by system environment variable.
If none is specified, network or tags must be specified.
If none value is specified the region members list will be removed.
If null, the /usr/sbin/policy-rc.d isn't created/changed.
If path is a file or directory, rights can be any right under MSDN FileSystemRights https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.filesystemrights.aspx.
If path is a registry key, rights can be any right under MSDN RegistryRights https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.registryrights.aspx.
If present a new module is installed.
If present a new repository is added or updated.
If present is supplied with a number argument, the module will attempt to update the record with the supplied data.
If present the host will be created in the cluster (includes enabled, disabled and offline states).
If present will ensure the app pool is configured and exists.
If present will ensure the mapped drive exists.
If present will ensure the policy is configured and exists.
If present, all given values will be added if they're missing.
If present, it adds a network static route.
If present, the specified privileges are granted, if absent they are revoked.
If present, will add or update a DNS server.
If present, will add or update an NTP server.
If present, will create or update organization.
If present, will ensure that the certificate at path is imported into the certificate store specified.
If present, will set or update timezone.
If present, will verify IP pool is present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify LAN Connectivity Policies are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify MAC pool is present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify SAN Connectivity Policies are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify Service Profile Templates are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify UUID pool is present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify VLANs are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify VSANs are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify WWNNs/WWPNs are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify disk slot is configured within policy. If absent, will verify disk slot is absent from policy.
If present, will verify iscsi vnic is configured within policy. If absent, will verify iscsi vnic is absent from policy.
If present, will verify local LUN is present on profile. If absent, will verify local LUN is absent on profile.
If present, will verify that the Managed Objects are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify that the disk group policy is present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify that the storage profile is present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify the resource is present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify vHBA templates are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify vNIC templates are present and will create if needed.
If present, will verify vnic is configured within policy. If absent, will verify vnic is absent from policy.
If primary_pvlans isn't specified, all PVLANs will be deleted if present.
If ratio is not provided when creating a new Wide IP, it will default to 1.
If raw format is used, disk storage will be allocated right away, also known as preallocated.
If raw is selected information will be returned in raw format from Azure Python SDK.
If remote_src=no (default), local path to archive file to copy to the target server; can be absolute or relative. If remote_src=yes, path on the target server to existing archive file to unpack.

If remote_src=yes and src contains ://, the remote machine will download the file from the URL first. (version_added 2.0). This is only for simple cases, for full download support use the get_url module.
If remove, the user is removed from each group in groups.
If replace, the user is added as a member of each group in groups and removed from any other groups.
If requestPayment, policy, tagging or versioning operations/API aren’t implemented by the endpoint, module doesn’t fail if related parameters requester_pays, policy, tags or versioning are None.

If request_type=renew, a forced renew will fail if the certificate being renewed has been issued within the past 30 days, regardless of the value of remaining_days or the return value of cert_days - the ECS API does not support the "renew" operation for certificates that are not at least 30 days old.

If request_type=renew, a renewal will fail if the certificate being renewed has been issued within the past 30 days, so do not set a remaining_days value that is within 30 days of the full lifetime of the certificate being acted upon. (e.g. if you are requesting Certificates with a 90 day lifetime, do not set remaining_days to a value 60 or higher).
If restarted will ensure the app pool exists and will restart, this is never idempotent.
If running then it will begin syncing if there is no active sync or will resume a suspended sync. If there is already a sync in progress, it will return with an OK status.
If saved, the .tgz backup bundle will be saved in dest.
If secondary_pvlans isn't specified, the primary PVLANs and each secondary promiscuous PVLAN will be created.
If set, each alias in aliases will be added to the host entry, and other aliases will be removed from the entry.
If size specified then unit must be specified. There is no space allowed in between size number and unit.
If snapshot_name specified snapshot_vm is required.
If source is set to all, then it is not possible to specify an oid. This will raise an error.
If src and dest are files and if the parent directory of dest doesn't exist, then the task will fail.
If src and dest are files, the parent directory of dest is not created and the task fails if it does not already exist.
If src is a directory, this must be a directory too.
If started will ensure the app pool exists and is started.
If starttls, the connection will try to upgrade to a secure SSL/TLS connection, before sending. If it is unable to do so it will fail.
If state is absent, name takes priority over email if both are specified.
If state is clear, event log entries are cleared for the target log.
If state is iscsidiscover it means that the iscsi attribute is being used to discover targets
If state is iscsilogin it means that the iscsi attribute is being used to login to the specified targets passed as part of the iscsi attribute
If state is present activate the host.
If state is absent then it will wait until the file does not exist.
If state is absent then it will wait until the regex does not match.
If state is not given, the NTP servers will be configured in the exact sequence.
If state is present and the name isn't found, it will attempt to create.
If state is present or started then it will wait until the file exists.
If state is present or started then it will wait until the regex matches.
If state is set to absent and VM exists, then VM is removed with its associated components.
If state is set to absent and virtual machine exists, then the specified virtual machine is removed with its associated components.
If state is set to absent, disk will be removed permanently from virtual machine configuration and from VMware storage.
If state is set to add or present will add the tags to the existing tag list of the given object.
If state is set to poweredoff and virtual machine exists with powerstate other than powered off, then the specified virtual machine is powered off.
If state is set to poweredon and VM does not exist, then VM is deployed with given parameters and powered on automatically.
If state is set to poweredon and virtual machine exists with powerstate other than powered on, then the specified virtual machine is powered on.
If state is set to present and VM does not exist, then VM is deployed with given parameters.
If state is set to present and VM exists, ensure the VM configuration conforms to given parameters.
If state is set to present and disk exists with different size, disk size is increased.
If state is set to present and virtual machine exists, ensure the virtual machine configurations conforms to task arguments.
If state is set to present, disk will be added if not present at given SCSI Controller and Unit Number.
If state is set to present, then VM is just checked for existence and facts are returned.
If state is set to rebootguest and virtual machine exists, then the virtual machine is rebooted.
If state is set to remove or absent will remove the tags from the existing tag list of the given object.
If state is set to restarted and virtual machine exists, then the virtual machine is restarted.
If state is set to set will replace the tags of the given objects with the user defined list of tags.
If state is set to shutdownguest and virtual machine exists, then the virtual machine is shutdown.
If state is set to suspended and virtual machine exists, then the virtual machine is set to suspended mode.
If state is set to one of the following poweredon, poweredoff, present, restarted, suspended and virtual machine does not exists, then virtual machine is deployed with given parameters.
If state is set to value other than present, then VM is transitioned into required state and facts are returned.
If state set to power-down-to-standby and force to true, then all powered off VMs will evacuated.
If state set to reboot-host and force as true, then host system is rebooted regardless of whether it is in maintenance mode.
If state set to shutdown-host and force as true, then host system is shutdown regardless of whether it is in maintenance mode.
If state=absent and authentication=off, authentication will be turned off.
If state=absent and authentication=on, authentication will be turned off.
If state=absent and authentication=on, authentication will be turned on.
If state=absent and vtp_password is provided, the proposed vtp_password has to match the existing one in order to remove it.
If state=absent and path is not set, the module will delete the mapped drive regardless of the target.
If state=absent and no vtp_password is provided, it remove the current VTP password.
If state=absent and the path is set, the module will throw an error if path does not match the target of the mapped drive.
If state=absent removes the whole host configuration.
If state=absent then this value does not need to be set if product_id is.
If state=absent this module will delete the group if it exists
If state=absent, only local_mac is supported to configure.
If state=absent, the module will attempt to remove the given key configuration. If a matching key configuration isn’t found on the device, the module will fail.
If state=absent, the module will remove the given key configuration if it exists.
If state=absent, the route will be removed, regardless of the non-required parameters.
If state=drained then it will only check for connections on the IP specified, you can use '0.0.0.0' to use all host IPs.
If state=present, enable=disable, interface DLDP enable will be turned off and related interface DLDP configuration will be cleared.
If state=present and the group doesn't exist then this must be set.
If state=present sets MOTD given in messagestate=absent removes it.
If state=present then either zip_file or s3_bucket must be present.
If state=present then the hotfix at source will be validated against this value, if it does not match an error will occur.
If state=present then this value MUST be set.
If state=present this module will ensure the group is created and is configured accordingly.
If status, obtain the status.
If stopped will ensure the app pool exists and is stopped.
If store_download is set to True, and path and filename is omitted, the file will be stored in the current directory with an automatic filename.
If strict is specified, values are tested for equality, and changes always result in updating or restarting. If ignore is specified, changes are ignored.
If suspended it will suspend any ongoing sync action, but return OK if there is no active sync or if the sync is already suspended

If tail_log=yes, the result of the task will include the last 4 KB of the CloudWatch log for the function execution. Log tailing only works if you use synchronous invocation wait=yes. This is usually used for development or testing Lambdas.
If text, data is a text string that is UTF-16LE encoded to bytes.
If text, secret is a text string that is UTF-16LE encoded to bytes.
If tls_client_cert and tls_client_key are set, this will enable TLS authentication.

If touch (new in 1.4), an empty file will be created if the path does not exist, while an existing file or directory will receive updated file access and modification times (similar to the way touch works from the command line).

If touch, an empty file will be created if the path does not exist, while an existing file or directory will receive updated file access and modification times (similar to the way touch works from the command line).
If touch, an empty file will be created if the path does not exist.
If true then name is ignored.
If true, an existing config will be replaced, even if it has not been changed.
If true, an existing secret will be replaced, even if it has not changed.
If true, forcefully adds the deploy key by deleting any existing deploy key with the same public key or title.
If true, queries the node (i.e. the docker daemon) the module communicates with.
If true, the deploy key will only be able to read repository contents. Otherwise, the deploy key will be able to read and write.
If try, the connection will attempt to setup a secure SSL/TLS session, before trying to send.
If type is stateless, the pool that is used must not have any members which define a rate_limit.
If unmounted, the device will be unmounted without changing fstab.
If vlan_trunk is configured to be true, this can be a combination of multiple ranges and numbers, example: 1-200, 205, 400-4094.
If yes allows install modules that contains commands those have the same names as commands that already exists.

If yes and dest is not a directory, will download the file every time and replace the file if the contents change. If no, the file will only be downloaded if the destination does not exist. Generally should be yes only for small local files.
If yes and state present, if an parent is given, it will get the first available prefix of the given prefix_length inside the given parent (and vrf, if given). Unused with state absent.
If yes and the tunnel mtu is fixed to a non-zero value, the tunnel will use the minimum of PMTU and MTU.
If yes and the tunnel mtu is set to 0, the tunnel will use the PMTU information.
If yes do not get a cached copy.
If yes installs modules marked as prereleases.
If yes it will go to the remote/target machine for the src.
If yes make invalid entries a fatal error, otherwise skip and continue.
If yes the module will save the configuration on the netscaler node if it makes any changes.
If yes the module will use the src path on the remote/target machine.
If yes will apply and activate existing inactive policy. If no, it will deactivate existing active policy. Generally should be yes only in cases where you want to activate new or existing policy.

If yes will upload the file every time and replace the file on the device. If no, the file will only be uploaded if it does not already exist. Generally should be yes only in cases where you have reason to believe that the image was corrupted during upload.
If yes, add or change the failover. This is applicable only for A records.
If yes, add or change the monitor. This is applicable only for A records.
If yes, add the user to the groups specified in groups.
If yes, allows to create new filesystem on devices that already has filesystem.
If yes, allows to remove volume group with logical volumes.

If yes, allows you to install a different version of a module that already exists on your computer in the case when a different one is not digitally signed by a trusted publisher and the newest existing module is digitally signed by a trusted publisher.

If yes, any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save all configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying yes.
If yes, any modified files in the working repository will be discarded. Prior to 0.7, this was always 'yes' and could not be disabled. Prior to 1.9, the default was `yes`
If yes, any modified files in the working tree will be discarded. Before 1.9 the default value was yes.
If yes, cleans the local repository of retrieved package files that can no longer be downloaded.
If yes, delete volume when deleting instance (if booted from volume)
If yes, deletes the volume when instance is terminated
If yes, dereferences symlinks and sets/gets attributes on symlink target, otherwise acts on symlink itself.
If yes, do export instead of checkout/update.
If yes, don't inspect database for password changes. Effective when pg_authid is not accessible (such as AWS RDS). Otherwise, make password changes as necessary.
If yes, fail when reassign_owned_by role does not exist. Otherwise just warn and continue.
If yes, fail when group or target_role doesn't exist. If no, just warn and continue.
If yes, fail when removing a language. Otherwise just log and continue.
If yes, fail when target role (for whom privs need to be granted) does not exist. Otherwise just warn and continue.
If yes, fail when user (role) can't be removed. Otherwise just log and continue.
If yes, if the block device and filesystem size differ, grow the filesystem into the space.
If yes, it will go to the remote/target machine for the src.
If yes, modified files will be discarded. If no, module will fail if it encounters modified files. Prior to 1.9 the default was yes.
If yes, only the ASM policy custom settings will be exported.
If yes, performs a /sbin/sysctl -p if the sysctl_file is updated. If no, does not reload sysctl even if the sysctl_file is updated.
If yes, remove unused dependency packages for all module states except build-dep. It can also be used as the only option.

If yes, removes all "leaf" packages from the system that were originally installed as dependencies of user-installed packages but which are no longer required by any such package. Should be used alone or when state is absent
If yes, skip image verification.
If yes, specifies that the NAT sends ARP requests.
If yes, stopping or restarting a service with dependent services will force the dependent services to stop or restart also.
If yes, text will be parsed as markdown.
If yes, the ASM policy will be exported inline as a string instead of a file.
If yes, the BIGIP will automatically create outbound connections to the active pool members in the specified pool using the configuration of the specified transport_config.
If yes, the VM will be update with new value.
If yes, the downloaded artifact's name is preserved, i.e the version number remains part of it.
If yes, the exported ASM policy will be in binary format.
If yes, the redirect will be forwarded to the client, otherwise the malformed HTTP will be silently ignored.
If yes, the registered node will not upload its installed packages information to Satellite server.
If yes, the remote file will be replaced when contents are different than the source.
If yes, the returned inline ASM policy content will be Base64 encoded.
If yes, the router will route a message to an existing connection on the same TMM as the message was received on.
If yes, they are python regexes.
If yes, which will replace the remote file when contents are different than the source.

If yes, will download the file every time and replace the file if the contents change. If no, will only download the file if it does not exist or the remote file has been modified more recently than the local file.
If True FCP storage domain LUNs will be overridden before adding.
If True ISCSI storage domain luns will be overridden before adding.
If True SSH keys will be regenerated on Virtual Machine.
If True any hosts in the cluster that are Non Responsive and still connected to storage will not be fenced.
If True auto-convergence is used during live migration of virtual machines.
If True compression is used during live migration of the virtual machine.
If True enable memory balloon optimization. Memory balloon is used to re-distribute / reclaim the host memory based on VM needs in a dynamic way.
If True enables KSM ksm for best performance inside NUMA nodes.
If True enables an optional reason field when a host is placed into maintenance mode from the Manager, allowing the administrator to provide an explanation for the maintenance.
If True enables an optional reason field when a virtual machine is shut down from the Manager, allowing the administrator to provide an explanation for the maintenance.
If True enables fencing on the cluster.
If True enables integration with an OpenAttestation server.
If True enables the oVirt/RHV to monitor cluster capacity for highly available virtual machines.
If True fencing will be temporarily disabled if the percentage of hosts in the cluster that are experiencing connectivity issues is greater than or equal to the defined threshold.
If True network interface will be set to start on boot.
If True network will be marked as network for VM.
If True storage domain blocks will be discarded upon deletion. Enabled by default.
If True storage domain will be formatted after removing it from oVirt/RHV.
If True the exposed host threads would be treated as cores which can be utilized by virtual machines.
If True the module will fetch additional data from the API.
If True then the permissions of the VM (only the direct ones, not the inherited ones) will be copied to the created template.
If True, hosts in this cluster will be used as Gluster Storage server nodes, and not for running virtual machines.
If True, hosts in this cluster will be used to run virtual machines.
If advertise_addr is not specified, it will be automatically detected when possible.
If backend is set to True, this (username, password) pair is used for authenticating to the ProxySQL instance.
If client_cert contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.
If consolidated, each vGPU is placed on the first physical card with available space. This is the default placement, utilizing all available space on the physical cards.
If create_mode=non_readable_secondary or create_mode=online_secondary, this value is ignored.
If create_option=copy then the value must be greater than or equal to the source's size.
If ct_log is not specified, the certificate uses the account default.
If ct_log is set to false, but the account settings are set to "always log", the certificate generation will fail.
If ct_log is specified and the account settings allow it, ct_log overrides the account default.
If deploy it means this host should deploy also hosted engine components.
If dest is a file, the backup file will be saved with that filename. The file extension will always be .tgz.
If dest is a folder, the backup file will be saved in the folder with the default filename generated from the ESXi server.
If dest is a relative path, the starting directory is determined by the remote host.
If detached is false, will include Output attribute containing any output from container run.
If disabled this affinity group doesn't take effect.
If eku is specified, it will override the extended key usage in the CSR.

If encrypt is no, the username and password are sent as a simple XOR scrambled byte string that is not encrypted. No special tools are required to get the username and password just knowledge of the protocol.
If error_option=continue-on-error, continue to process configuration data on error. The error is recorded and negative response is generated if any errors occur.
If error_option=rollback-on-error, rollback to the original configuration if any error occurs. This requires the remote Netconf server to support the error_option=rollback-on-error capability.
If error_option=stop-on-error, abort the config edit on first error.

If fast_forward is set to True, fast_forward will bypass the query processing layer (rewriting, caching) and pass through the query directly as is to the backend server. If omitted the proxysql database default for fast_forward is False.
If field_to_match is header, then header must also be specified.
If frontend is set to True, this (username, password) pair is used for authenticating to the mysqld servers against any hostgroup.
If ip_address and canonical_name are both omitted when state=absent, then all hosts entries will be removed.
If kdc is already an LDAP URI then this is ignored.
If labels_state is replace and labels is not provided or empty then all labels assigned to node are removed and labels_to_remove is ignored.
If match_filter is defined, it will take precedence over the properties, but not on the id
If method is post or get, make the module fail in case an ACME error is returned.

If name contains a list of nodes, the output will provide information on all nodes registered at the swarm, including nodes that left the swarm but haven't been removed from the cluster on swarm managers and nodes that are unreachable.
If name is set to chocolatey and Chocolatey is not installed on the host, this will be the version of Chocolatey that is installed. You can also set the chocolateyVersion environment var.
If name parameter format is name:tag, then tag value from name will take precedence.

If negate_match_pattern is set to True, only queries not matching the query text will be considered as a match. This acts as a NOT operator in front of the regular expression matching against match_pattern.
If negativeno VMs in this group should run on the host defined by host_rule.
If negativeno VMs in this group should run on the this host.

If networks parameter is provided, will inspect each network to see if there exists a bridge network with optional parameter com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4. If such a network is found, then published ports where no host IP address is specified will be bound to the host IP pointed to by com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4. Note that the first bridge network with a com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4 value encountered in the list of networks is the one that will be used.

If networks_cli_compatible is set to yes, this module will behave as docker run --network and will *not* add the default network if networks is specified. If networks is not specified, the default network will be attached.
If no Instance Type won't be set as highly available.
If no Virtual Machine will be unset as stateless.
If no Virtual Machine won't be set as delete protected.
If no Virtual Machine won't be set as highly available.

If option is not presented for the interface and state is present option will be added. If option already exists and is not pre-up, up, post-up or down, it's value will be updated. pre-up, up, post-up and down options can't be updated, only adding new options, removing existing ones or cleaning the whole option set are supported
If org is not specified, the organization from the client represented by client_id is used.
If ou is specified, it will override the organizational units "ou=" present in the subject distinguished name of the CSR, if any.
If owner is not defined, the owner will be set as login_user or session_role.
If path is a file or directory, rights can be any right under MSDN FileSystemRights https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.filesystemrights.aspx.
If path is a registry key, rights can be any right under MSDN RegistryRights https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.registryrights.aspx.
If positiveall VMs in this group should run on the host defined by host_rule.
If positiveall VMs in this group should run on the this host.
If process_username is not specified, then the remote process will run under a Network Logon under this account.
If retrieve_orders is object_list, this will be a list of objects.
If retrieve_orders is url_list, this will be a list of URLs.
If self is true then this parameter is ignored.
If separated, each vGPU is placed on a separate physical card, if possible. This can be useful for improving vGPU performance.
If services is defined, only the containers listed there will be restarted.
If services is defined, only the containers listed there will be stopped.

If state is absent and overwrite is True, this module will remove the given resource record unconditionally. If state is absent and overwrite is False, this module will fail if the provided record_data do not match exactly with the existing resource record's record_data.
If state is latest, the latest pre-release package will be installed.

If state is present and overwrite is True, this module will replace an existing resource record of the same name with the provided record_data. If state is present and overwrite is False, this module will fail if there is an existing resource record with the same name and type, but different resource data.
If state=="absent" then all storage pool drives will be erase
If state=="present" then delete all available storage array drives that have security enabled.
If state=absent other options will be ignored except of name and schema.
If state=absent, in case the relationship with the parent is a member relationship, will unassign the entity as a member of the parent.
If state=absent, stack will be removed.
If state=absent, the route will be removed, regardless of the non-required options.
If state=absent, the route will be removed, regardless of the non-required parameters.
If state=absent, the vrf will be removed, regardless of the non-required parameters.
If state=exact and value is an empty list, all values for this attribute will be removed.
If state=present and deployment exists, it will be updated.
If state=present, attributes necessary to create an entry. Existing entries are never modified. To assert specific attribute values on an existing entry, use ldap_attr module instead.
If state=present, in case the entity already exists, will update the entity if it is needed.
If state=present, in case the relationship with the parent is a member relationship, will assign the entity as a member of the parent.
If state=present, template will be created.
If state=present, value or list of values to use when creating the entry. It can either be a string or an actual list of strings.
If storage_encrypted is true and and this option is not provided, the default encryption key is used.
If subject_alt_name is specified, it will override the subject alternate names in the CSR.

If throttle is a percentage and bandwidth is 0 then bandwidth throttling will be disabled. If throttle is expressed as a data rate (bytes/sec) then this option is ignored. Default is 0 (no bandwidth throttling).
If topic is not specified this will have no impact, but the SES setting is updated even if there is no topic.
If true all networks will be synchronized before modification
If true all the attributes of the hosts should be included in the response.
If true all the attributes of the virtual machines should be included in the response.
If true allow a MAC address to be used multiple times in a pool.
If true and state is present save memory of the Virtual Machine if it's running.
If true and state is restore restore memory of the Virtual Machine.
If true and state is upgraded reboot host after successful upgrade.
If true and state is upgraded run check for upgrade action before executing upgrade action.
If true disable the graphics console for this virtual machine.
If true network configuration will be persistent, otherwise it is temporary. Default true since Ansible 2.8.
If true options will be encrypted when send to agent.
If true performed search will take case into account.
If true the storage domain don't have to be in MAINTENANCE state, so the storage connection is updated.
If true verify connectivity between host and engine.
If true, in addition return remote_vv_file inside vm dictionary, which contains compatible content for remote-viewer application. Works only state is running.
If true, the VM will migrate to any available host.
If true, the VM will migrate when placement_policy=user-migratable but not when placement_policy=pinned.
If true, the sound card is added to the instance type.
If true, the sound card is added to the virtual machine.
If true, the update will not be applied to the VM immediately and will be only applied when virtual machine is restarted.
If true, use memory ballooning.
If true, use smart card authentication.
If true, virtio scsi will be enabled.
If truekernel_params, initrd_path and kernel_path will persist in virtual machine configuration, if False it will be used for run once.
If type is database, this parameter can be omitted, in which case privileges are set for the database specified via database.

If type is table, partition table, sequence or function, the special valueALL_IN_SCHEMA can be provided instead to specify all database objects of type type in the schema specified via schema. (This also works with PostgreSQL < 9.0.) (ALL_IN_SCHEMA is available for function and partition table from version 2.8)
If type is function, colons (":") in object names will be replaced with commas (needed to specify function signatures, see examples)
If undeploy it means this host should un-deploy hosted engine components and this host will not function as part of the High Availability cluster.
If use_ssl is set to True, connections by this user will be made using SSL connections. If omitted the proxysql database default for use_ssl is False.
If use_ssl is set to True, connections to this server will be made using SSL connections. If omitted the proxysql database default for use_ssl is False.
If uuid option is provided, it takes precedence over name for server selection. This allows to update the server’s name.
If wait_for_public_IPv is set and state is active, the module will wait for both events consequently, applying the timeout twice.
If yes Instance Type will be set as highly available.
If yes VM cannot start if it does not satisfy the vm_rule.
If yes VM cannot start on host if it does not satisfy the host_rule.
If yes Virtual Machine will be set as delete protected.
If yes Virtual Machine will be set as highly available.
If yes Virtual Machine will be set as stateless.
If yes the cloud_init or sysprep parameters will be saved for the virtual machine and the virtual machine won't be started as run-once.
If yes the module will fetch additional data from the API.
If yes then the disks of the created virtual machine will be cloned and independent of the template.
If yes then the permissions of the template (only the direct ones, not the inherited ones) will be copied to the created virtual machine.
If yes, indicates that the group created is a system group.
If API keys of the user should be generated.
If AccessLevel is lower than Administrator, which Groups the user has access
If AccessLevel is lower than Administrator, which plugs the user has access
If AccessLevel is lower than Administrator, which ports the user has access
If Ansible detects that the current loop is using a variable which has already been defined, it will raise an error to fail the task.
If Ansible is installed as root:
If Ansible is installed only for your user:
If Ansible modules are the tools in your workshop, playbooks are your instruction manuals, and your inventory of hosts are your raw material.

If Ansible were to load ansible.cfg from a world-writable current working directory, it would create a serious security risk. Another user could place their own config file there, designed to make Ansible run malicious code both locally and remotely, possibly with elevated privileges. For this reason, Ansible will not automatically load a config file from the current working directory if the directory is world-writable.
If Backend store is lvm, specify the name of the volume group.
If Chocolatey is missing from the system, the module will install it.
If Cloud CDN is enabled. null if not set.
If False, append a newline to the data. Default False
If GSSAPI is not available, the usage of 'ipa_pass' is required.
If Group Members are defined, and mode="delete", only group members will be removed.
